data: Drinking 3 cups of coffee every day
Meditating daily improves my quality of sleep
Daily meditation increases the number of hours I sleep
Meditating daily improves my quality of sleep
Meditating makes me calmer. Maybe this increases the amount of REM sleep.
Milk in your diet could be present or absent
Exercise in your day could be present or absent
Number of cups of coffee, Number of helpings of ice-cream, Number of glasses of water
drinking coffee 3 times a day, going for a run 2 times a day
drinking water 2 times as fast, going for a run at twice the speed
a headache could be present or absent, dairy in your diet could be present or absent etc.
weight in pounds, miles ran, number of cups of coffee, hours slept etc.
the severity of a headache can be measured on a scale of 1-5 (1 being mild and 5 being a severe headache).
drinking coffee 3 times a day, going to the bathroom 10 times a day etc.
drinking coffee fast or slow, peeing slow or fast.
Participants will remember their quality of sleep when they wake up and might forget this as the day progresses.
Maybe they are away from devices (e.g. running outside), or due to a lack of alertness (e.g. sleepiness)..
Asking participants about their sleepiness right before they fall asleep might provide the most correct data, but participants might be too tired to bother providing this data.
Asking participants about their sleepiness when they wake up as to ensure better responses.
Participants should be able to understand text messages so that they reply easily

Hello! This is your 8:00 PM reminder to measure 'Drinking a 5% ABV (+- 0.5%) between 6pm and 8 pm local time' today. Did you drink a 5% ABV (+- 0.5%) beer between 6pm and 8pm local time absent or present in your day today? Reply Yes for present, No for absent.
Hello! This is your 8:00 PM reminder to measure 'Drinking beer'. Did you drink a 5% ABV (+- 0.5%) beer between 6pm and 8pm today? Reply Yes or No.
Drinking coffee decreases quality of sleep
Running in the morning increases energy levels
Participants do a light walk for 30 mins in the morning
Participants run for 30 mins in the morning
Eating white bread decreases number of bowel movements
An experiment for this hypothesis won't teach you about the effect of brown bread on the number of bowel movements
DO NOT consume any caffeinated drink throughout the day
Continue performing your daily activities as usual
Measure effect: in the evening, write down how bloated you feel on a scale of 1-5
Send your measurements to Gut Instinct through sms
Repeat steps for the next 7 days
Buy a specific brand of coffee beans for a week (experiment creator should specify the brand)
Be prepared to not drink coffee for one week
Prepare coffee in the morning using a specific recipe (experiment creator should specify the recipe)
Consume coffee ONLY in the morning. DO NOT consume any more caffeine throughout the day
Measure effect: in the evening, write down how bloated you feel on a scale of 1-5
Send your measurements to Gut Instinct through sms
Repeat steps for the next 7 days
Buy a specific brand of coffee beans for a week (experiment creator should specify the brand)
Prepare coffee in the morning using a specific recipe (experiment creator should specify the recipe)
Start off by making a list of activities you will avoid doing
I think that daily exercise affects my sleep
Daily exercise increases the number of hours I sleep
Exercising for 30 mins daily improves my quality of sleep
Exercising makes me physically exhausted at night and my body has lesser energy to focus on anything else before/while sleeping

waiting 30 seconds between reps, biking 2 times as fast
a muscle cramp could be present or absent, incidence of injury etc.
weight in pounds, miles ran, number of cups of water, hours slept etc.
perceived energy levels in the evening can be measured on a scale of 1-5 (1 being high energy and 5 being a low energy), hunger at the end of the day, attentiveness etc.
exercising 3 times a day, going to the bathroom 10 times a day etc.
eating meat fast or slow, drinking water fast or slow.
Participants will remember their quality of sleep when they wake up and might forget this as the day progresses.

Asking participants about their sleepiness right before they fall asleep might provide the most correct data, but participants might be too tired to bother providing this data.
Asking participants about their sleepiness when they wake up as to ensure better responses.

Drinking Soylent daily improves my quality of sleep

Milk in your diet could be present or absent

Number of cups of coffee, Number of helpings of ice-cream, Number of glasses of water
drinking coffee 3 times a day, going for a run 2 times a day
drinking water 2 times as fast, going for a run at twice the speed
a headache could be present or absent, dairy in your diet could be present or absent etc.
weight in pounds, miles ran, number of cups of coffee, hours slept etc.
the severity of a headache can be measured on a scale of 1-5 (1 being mild and 5 being a severe headache).
drinking coffee 3 times a day, going to the bathroom 10 times a day etc.
drinking coffee fast or slow, peeing slow or fast.
Participants will remember their quality of sleep when they wake up and might forget this as the day progresses.
Maybe they are away from devices (e.g. running outside), or due to a lack of alertness (e.g. sleepiness)..
Asking participants about their sleepiness right before they fall asleep might provide the most correct data, but participants might be too tired to bother providing this data.
Asking participants about their sleepiness when they wake up as to ensure better responses.
Participants should be able to understand text messages so that they reply easily
